Merge branch 'master' into prod-exec-row

timeline.bodyText: Doesn't look like it's returning a partition, more like a partition hash code. Used like a utility function, should be static probably. Some javadoc may help in any case.
timeline.author: taburet

replies.bodyText:
This function converts an arbitrary integer to a positive integer, which is then interpreted as a logical partition.
The notion of "partition" is used here to provide an analogy with our partition pool, which also uses logical partitions [1], not physical.
[1] com.hazelcast.spi.impl.operationexecutor.impl.OperationExecutorImpl#getPartitionThreadId(int, int)
replies.author: devozerov

timeline.bodyText: Looks like a pretty central interface in physical node hierarchy. Probably deserves a better javadoc.
timeline.author: taburet

replies.bodyText: PhysicalNode will be described in detail in future pull requests. Here it is just used to maintain compilation.
replies.author: devozerov

timeline.bodyText: Does it return an exact value, overestimates or underestimates? One may think it just returns the number of columns, probably a better name is something like get(Over/Under)EstimatedSize.
timeline.author: taburet

replies.bodyText: This value is used to estimate memory requirements. We assume that it is relatively accurate. Bug again, this is not a concern of this ticket. The row width is currently used in IO handling, which will be prepared in a separate PR. I'll add JavaDocs with clarifications and possibly rename the method. Otherwise, we will have unnecessary conflicts.
replies.author: devozerov
